movie.title: The Passion of the Christ
movie.plot: A graphic portrayal of the last twelve hours of Jesus of Nazareth's life.
movie.awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 31 wins & 21 nominations.

events.title: Fanny Brawne moves in next door to John Keats

movie.title: Bright Star
movie.plot: In 1818, high-spirited young Fanny Brawne finds herself increasingly intrigued by the handsome but aloof poet John Keats, who lives next door to her family friends the Dilkes. After reading a book of his poetry, she finds herself even more drawn to the taciturn Keats. Although he agrees to teach her about poetry, Keats cannot act on his reciprocated feelings for Fanny, since as a struggling poet he has no money to support a wife.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 16 wins & 52 nominations.

events.title: Lincoln visits the battlefield at Petersburg

movie.title: Lincoln
movie.plot: The revealing story of the 16th US President's tumultuous final months in office. In a nation divided by war and the strong winds of change, Lincoln pursues a course of action designed to end the war, unite the country and abolish slavery. With the moral courage and fierce determination to succeed, his choices during this critical moment will change the fate of generations to come.

movie.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
movie.plot: Outlaw Jesse James is rumored to be the 'fastest gun in the West'. An eager recruit into James' notorious gang, Robert Ford eventually grows jealous of the famed outlaw and, when Robert and his brother sense an opportunity to kill James, their murderous action elevates their target to near mythical status.
movie.awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 25 wins & 67 nominations.

events.title: Ansar Dine announce that Timbuktu is under Sharia Law

movie.title: Timbuktu
movie.plot: A cattle herder and his family who reside in the dunes of Timbuktu find their quiet lives -- which are typically free of the Jihadists determined to control their faith -- abruptly disturbed. A look at the brief occupation of Timbuktu by militant Islamic rebels.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 28 wins & 20 nominations.
